articles.summary: Solar Orbiter Images Sun’s Poles New Species of Tyrannosauroid Dinosaur Discovered in Mongolia Scientifically named Khankhuuluu mongoliensis, the newly-identified tyrannosauroid species is the closest-known ancestor to Tyrannosaurus rex. Khankhuuluu mongoliensis. Image credit: Julius Csotonyi. Khankhuuluu mongoliensis roamed our planet during the Cretaceous period, some 86 million years ago.
